content:
Meeting in ~10 minutes

  • Blog post + release notes assignment
  • Any follow-up to point release (cc @Pietro Albini)
@T-release meeting!
alright, let's actually switch the order from what I suggested -- @Pietro Albini anything of note for release?
There was at least one patch we've pushed in to avoid forgetting to bump stable release version
yeah
so the big problem we had was that I forgot to bump the stable version number, which resulted in us having to run the release again
the script I wrote as part of CI should prevent this failure case in the future
other than the additional usual CI weirdness there wasn't anything of note for the point release
ok, great
I'd like to eventually have the capability to do private releases to avoid the "we're going to announce a bug and release a fix in 8+ hours", but I don't have the time to work on it right now
@triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
Alright, for the blog post and release note writing, does anyone want to volunteer (for either)? I believe last cycle we had @tmandry writing release notes and @cuviper on blog post, right?
correct
in the foreseeable future I won't have time for release tasks other than running every other release :(
We should write down a rotation, I suppose, for each of these tasks -- it sounds like we have roughly 3 people with potential capacity to do one per release?
@tmandry, @cuviper, and myself, right?

:wave: hi everyone long time listener first time caller :P

First, Sorry if this is not an appropriate venue/time for this question but I was directed here if there’s a better place for it please do let me know. Second, Thank you so much for1.58.1 and all the hard work yinz do :)

I was curious if you think a .2 will be released once https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/92786 (and its MR https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/93081) are rolled into a build :smile:. It’s something we are tracking for aarch64 machines.

Thanks again!
Ah, we can discuss that before the end of the meeting
seems like 3 of us, yes

simulacrum said:

tmandry, cuviper, and myself, right?

Based on this -- I can do release notes, and then maybe @tmandry you'd be up for writing the blog post?
I can probably do that
Alright
I'm wondering if we should ask for external people interested in helping with some tasks
relnotes are something an existing team member probably has to do, but we could ask for help with the blog post
(i.e. it's easy to detect something missing/wrong with the blog, way less so with the relnotes without doing them again or somehow memorizing all the changes landed six weeks ago)
there are some juicy features this time -- asm! and destructuring-assignments, at least

I suspect sourcing text from other teams for the blog post may be feasible, but I'd be worried about timeline -- we don't typically have that much time, and at least between us we can be somewhat more committed :)
I was thinking less of sourcing text for other teams and more looking if there are individuals interested in doing that work and then potentially joining the team after a while
I'm personally hoping we can increasingly automate release notes, in which case the blog post is all that's left, and then we can rotate that more easily
I'm not opposed to trying to see if there's folks interested in taking blog post on, though, and potentially eventually joining
especially if there's someone with technical writing background ... (no offense to us)
sure, yeah
it's not something I'm likely to have bandwidth for this cycle though
On a related note, next week @nikomatsakis and I are going to put a call out for someone who can publish a newsletter for wg-async

simulacrum said:

I'm personally hoping we can increasingly automate release notes, in which case the blog post is all that's left, and then we can rotate that more easily

isn't there crater triage too? (which is also "sensitive")
eh, crater triage is something I'm typically not opposed and can slot into my schedule fairly easily
ok, sounds like we have a plan on blog post / release notes for this cycle
and we can try and revisit exploratory plans for expanding the rotation/adding more folks interested -- maybe based on some of the responders to @tmandry + Niko's call :)
@triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
ok, returning to @deg4uss3r (Ricky)'s question
I suspect this should be stable-nominated but left in T-compiler's hands in terms of approval
and beta, of course, meaning it would ship in 1.59.0
yes
I'll go ahead and do that, and we can revisit if it's accepted for stable backport whether to do another release.
@triagebot end-topic
@deg4uss3r (Ricky) that would mean a release on Feb 24 for 1.59.0

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.

cuviper said:

deg4uss3r (Ricky) that would mean a release on Feb 24 for 1.59.0

That makes sense to me ty!
@triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
I spoke to Xanewok who said he'd look into doing subtree for RLS, btw
ok, thanks all! :wave:

@Pietro Albini sent me a ping about this conversation.

I don't think I'm up to _writing_ the release blog posts, but I'd be more than happy to help edit and review them. Sometimes just knowing that you have an editor makes writing easier.
Hi. I could try to help out with blog posts.
